channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In Peru, criminal gangs are targeting schools in poor neighborhoods for extortion
item.description: The president of one of Lima's largest parent-teacher associations says at least 1,000 schools in the Peruvian capital are being extorted and that mos...

item.title: The hidden cost of oil: Families fractured by a pipeline project
item.description: As the 900-mile East African Crude Oil Pipeline project takes shape in Uganda, there is the promise of economic benefit. But it's shaking up the lives...

item.title: The latest on the deadly Texas flash flooding. And, U.S. to send new tariff rates
item.description: Local officials are being pressed for answers over the deadly flash flooding in Texas that left dozens dead. And, the Trump administration plans to se...

item.title: Where Do Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Negotiations Stand?
item.description: Hamas wants to ensure that a new cease-fire includes a guarantee that negotiations will lead to a permanent end to the Gaza war.

item.title: Why some see the dollar's drop as a sign America is losing its financial might
item.description: The dollar has just posted its worst first-half of a year since 1973. And now investors wonder — is it a sign that America is losing its financial sta...

item.title: Officials Feared Flood Risk to Youth Camps but Rejected Warning System
item.description: Kerr County had discussed buying such things as water gauges and sirens after previous flood disasters. But as with many rural Texas counties, cost wa...

item.title: New Deadlines, New Letters — Same Tariff Uncertainty
item.description: The Trump administration is keen to strike deals as it dangles an extension to trading partners. But it’s also issuing threats to some of them.

item.title: Supreme Court Insists on Reams of Paper for Case Briefs in Digital Age
item.description: The court’s rules require many litigants to submit 40 copies of their briefs, resulting in millions of pages printed each term. Critics call the proce...

item.title: Are seed oils actually bad for your health? Here's the science behind the controversy
item.description: Health Secretary RFK Jr. has said vegetable oils, like canola and soybean, are "poisoning Americans." But many researchers say the evidence isn't ther...

item.title: The Ruthless Ambition of Stephen Miller
item.description: The most powerful man in the West Wing is getting what he wants. Is Trump?

item.title: Canada Shipping Natural Gas to Asia as It Looks Beyond the US for Trade
item.description: A tanker is headed to South Korea with a first shipment of liquefied natural gas from Canada, which hopes to reduce its export reliance on its neighbo...

item.title: Typhoon Danas Strikes Taiwan
item.description: The storm left hundreds of thousands of homes without power and crushed the gate of a well-known temple in southwest Taiwan.

item.title: ‘Hallmarks of Institutional Racism’ Found in Police Killing of Kumanjayi Walker
item.description: A coroner said that she could not exclude the possibility that an officer’s racist attitudes contributed to the death of Kumanjayi Walker in 2019.

item.title: Indonesia Volcano Eruption Sends Ash Soaring 11 Miles High
item.description: The ash cloud above Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki on Monday was about four times taller than the one produced by an eruption there last month.

item.title: What’s at Stake as Netanyahu and Trump Meet in Washington
